alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 5:25PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Line Creek near Senioa affecting Spalding, Fayette and Coweta Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senioa, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Line Creek near Senioa. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10 feet, Minor flooding of the natural flood plain begins which primarily affects agricultural and wooded areas. A small dirt utility access road near the Georgia Highway 85 bridge goes underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:01 PM EDT Monday the stage was 10 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:01 PM EDT Monday was 10 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
